snippet: Broader policies in New York City, like those involving stop-and-frisk tactics, need more rigorous oversight.
abstract: Editorial criticizes New York City Mayor Michael Bloomberg for being opposed to bill pending in City Council that would make the police department subject to oversight by an inspector general; contends an inspector general could only strengthen oversight in a police department that clearly needs it.
lead_paragraph: Broader policies in New York City, like those involving stop-and-frisk tactics, need more rigorous oversight.

headline.seo: The N.Y.P.D. Needs an Inspector General
headline.main: An Inspector General for the Police
headline.print_headline: An Inspector General for the Police
